channel.title: CVE Feed for Cisco -- Cisco Smart Software Manager On-Prem
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Cisco -- Cisco Smart Software Manager On-Prem

item.title: CVE-2022-20808|2024-09-16T19:04:27.633Z -- cisco -- cisco%20smart%20software%20manager%20on-prem
item.description: A vulnerability in Cisco Smart Software Manager On-Prem (SSM On-Prem) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to incorrect handling of multiple simultaneous device registrations on Cisco SSM On-Prem. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending multiple device registration requests to Cisco SSM On-Prem. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS condition on an affected device.

item.title: CVE-2021-1141|2024-09-16T19:24:48.710Z -- cisco -- cisco%20smart%20software%20manager%20on-prem
item.description: Multiple vulnerabilities in the web UI of Cisco Smart Software Manager Satellite could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system. For more information about these vulnerabilities, see the Details section of this advisory.

item.title: CVE-2021-1142|2024-09-16T18:03:52.406Z -- cisco -- cisco%20smart%20software%20manager%20on-prem
item.description: Multiple vulnerabilities in the web UI of Cisco Smart Software Manager Satellite could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system. For more information about these vulnerabilities, see the Details section of this advisory.

item.title: CVE-2024-20419|2024-08-08T03:55:29.214Z -- cisco -- cisco%20smart%20software%20manager%20on-prem
item.description: A vulnerability in the authentication system of Cisco Smart Software Manager On-Prem (SSM On-Prem) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to change the password of any user, including administrative users. This vulnerability is due to improper implementation of the password-change process. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP requests to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to access the web UI or API with the privileges of the compromised user.
